parameters.name: take
parameters.description:
Number of hits to return. 
If client does not specify Take the server MAY apply a default Take value
(which will be returned in the SearchResult object).
The default value is not guaranteed to be the same for different requests"

energyProduction.description:
Total power production during the period in MWh. 
Must be non-negative. 
 
            
The unit is MWh.
This means that if this baseline interval covers
the period 08:00 to 08:30 and has a EnergyConsumption of 10 (MWh),
the actual energy produced during the entire interval is
10MWh, and the average power consumption is 20MW.

energyConsumption.description:
Total power consumption during the period in MWh. 
Must be non-negative. 
 
            
The unit is MWh.
This means that if this baseline interval covers
the period 08:00 to 08:30 and has a EnergyConsumption of 10 (MWh),
the actual energy usage during the entire interval is
10MWh, and the average power consumption is 20MW.

averagePowerConsumption.description:
Average power consumption in MW.
Must be non-negative.

averagePowerProduction.description:
Average power production in MW 
Must be non-negative.

BaseLineInterval.description: BaseLineInterval covers a fixed interval in time, e.g. one minute from 15:00 to 15:01 on a specific date. Dates are always UTC and should always be sent and parsed as ISO-8856-1 with the UTC time zone reference, 'Z', to avoid ambiguity. Each interval specifies at least one of the four energy/power values

Portfolio.description: A portfolio represents a collection of one or more assets - e.g. batteries, dispatchable generators, etc - that can participate in a flexibility market.

gridNodeId.description:
The grid node this order applies to. 
Calculated and validated for sell orders.
Required for buy orders.

portfolioId.description:
The portfolio for which this order applies.  
Required on create for sell orders.
Not updatable.

quantity.description:
The amount of power or energy being sold.
            
Unit: Mega watt, or MW, or MWh/h. 

For Power, it denotes the max (in absolute terms) power
consumption/production during that period.
            
For Energy, it denotes the energy available during the specified
period. The unit is still MW, thus the length of the interval needs
to be taken into account to calculate the actual energy usage/production.

periodFrom.description: The timestamp indicating the start of the interval for which this order applies.

periodTo.description: The timestamp indicating the end of the interval for which this order applies.
